definition[0]: speaking or behaving in a way that is not polite and is likely to offend or annoy people
example[1]: I didn’t mean to be rude, but I had to leave early.
example[2]: Why are you so rude to her?
note[1]: it is rude to do something
definition[1]: rude jokes, words, songs etc are about sex
definition[2]: made in a simple basic way
definition[3]: not following the rules of good social behaviour or treating other people with a lack of respect
example[6]: He’s the rudest man I’ve ever met.
definition[4]: not following the rules of good social behaviour. Impolite sounds rather formal
example[9]: It’s not polite to talk with your mouth full of food.
definition[5]: behaving in a way that is a little rude, especially when this is amusing or annoying – used especially about children
example[11]: Let go, you cheeky monkey (=cheeky child)!
definition[6]: saying things that are likely to upset or embarrass someone, without intending to
example[14]: How could you be so tactless?
definition[7]: speaking or behaving in a way that is likely to upset or offend someone
example[15]: His remarks are offensive to African-Americans.
definition[8]: speaking or behaving in a way that is very rude and offensive to someone
example[17]: comments that are insulting to women
example[18]: The article was full of insulting language.
definition[9]: rather rude. Discourteous  sounds very formal and is often used when talking about being careful not to upset someone’s feelings
example[19]: He did not wish to appear discourteous towards his host.
example[20]: It would seem discourteous to refuse her offer.
definition[10]: behaving in a rude way, especially because you have never been taught how to behave politely
example[21]: Ill-mannered movie-goers talked throughout the entire picture.
definition[11]: not showing the proper respect for someone or something
example[23]: I felt her comments were disrespectful to all the people who have worked so hard on this project.
definition[12]: not showing a proper respect for someone, especially by asking or talking about subjects that you do not have a right to know about
example[24]: an impertinent question about his private life
example[26]: Would it be impertinent to ask how old you are?
definition[13]: behaving in a way that is deliberately very rude to someone in authority
example[27]: The girl’s only response was an insolent stare.
definition[14]: rude, and having no respect for people who are older or more important
example[29]: The boy gave an impudent smile.
definition[15]: showing a lack of respect for someone or something who people are supposed to respect – used especially about comedy programmes and newspaper articles
example[30]: an irreverent look at the week’s events
